resources.name: Supportive Services for Veteran Families (SSVF)
resources.address: Oak Arbor, 4507 Hwy 49 South, Hattiesburg, MS 39401
resources.description: Promotes housing stability among very low-income Veteran families who reside in or are transitioning to permanent housing from Jackson, MS south to the coast

resources.name: Veterans Crisis Line
resources.description: 24/7 free confidential crisis support for veterans and families experiencing mental health crises, PTSD, suicidal thoughts

resources.name: Mississippi 211 (2-1-1)
resources.phone_alt: Dial 211 and press 6 for homeless services
resources.address: Call center in Jackson, available statewide
resources.description: Free, confidential information and referral service connecting to health, human, and social services. Available 24/7. Dial 2-1-1 and press 6 for homeless veteran services.

resources.name: Mississippi Department of Employment Security (MDES) - Veterans Services
resources.description: Specialized benefits for veterans with information about housing, employment assistance, and job services. Veterans receive priority services from MDES.

resources.name: National Call Center for Homeless Veterans
resources.description: Emergency assistance and housing referrals for veterans experiencing homelessness or at imminent risk

resources.name: U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs - Mississippi
resources.address: National organization with facilities in Mississippi
resources.description: Nationwide services and resources for veterans including healthcare, benefits, homeless services, and women veterans programs

resources.name: HUD-VASH Program (Mississippi)
resources.description: HUD-Veterans Affairs Supportive Housing vouchers combining rental assistance with VA case management and services for homeless veterans

resources.name: VA Home Loan Guaranty Services
resources.description: VA home loan guarantee program helping veterans purchase or refinance homes

resources.name: Hire Heroes USA
resources.description: Employment assistance and job placement services for veterans overcoming employment barriers

resources.name: Wounded Warrior Project
resources.description: Support and services for post-9/11 veterans and service members with physical or mental injuries

resources.name: 988 Suicide & Crisis Lifeline
resources.description: 24/7 free and confidential support for people in distress with crisis support and prevention resources

resources.name: SAMHSA Service Members, Veterans, and Families Technical Assistance Center
resources.description: Assists in finding behavioral health resources and services with provider training and webinars

additional_resources.homeless_veteran_hotline: 1-877-424-3838 - National Call Center for Homeless Veterans

notes: This directory includes major state and federal veteran resources in Mississippi. For county-specific services, contact your local 211 or MDES office. Many services are free and confidential.
